Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Since 2020, the number of people, especially Black people, killed by the police has continued to rise, according to the Mapping Police Violence database.
So far this year, 214 Black lives have been lost during encounters with police, nearing the 264 killed in 2020.
Researchers behind Mapping Police Violence released a new database Wednesday that focuses on nonfatal police encounters in the United States between 2017 and 2022, the Guardian first reported.

The database found that in each year, over 300,000 people experienced use of force by police that includes chemical sprays, K-9 dog attacks, neck restraints, stun guns as well as beanbags and baton strikes.
Black people are more susceptible to nonfatal police violence than being killed by police, the report found.
